ğ… is mostly easily and correctly transcribed as W/V  

However just like the [coptic](coptic.html) letter â²© (which is wrongly transcribed as 'u') there seems to be a little bit more to it:  

ğ… Strange [ypsilon](ypsilon.html) letter between [Y](Y.html),V,W,R,G! ğŒ°ğŒ¹ğ…=ever (ğ…:VR/WG:â²©) ğŒ°ğŒ¹ğ…=ewig in gothic  

G component:  

ğŒ°ğŒ½ğŒ°ğŒ·ğŒ½ğŒ´ğŒ¹ğ…ğŒ°ğŒ½ 	 ...neigen++	 bend down,bow  
ğŒ°ğŒ¹ğ…=ewig/ever  (v also carried by vau/vir [ğŒ¹](ğŒ¹.html) )  
ğ…ğŒ¹ğŒ²ğŒ°ğŒ½ 	 guergon/wegaron > war  
ğ…ğ‚ğŒ°ğ„ğ‰ğŒ³ğŒ¿ğƒ  Î³rat : Wanderung (gress!)  

R component:  
ğƒ[ğ…](ğ….html)ğŒ¹ğŒ½[ğŒ¸](ğŒ¸.html)ğƒ â‹ strength  
ğ…ğŒ¿ğŒ»ğ…ğŒ° 	 wulwe	âˆšWolf â‡” Welfen <  Ruava < robber  

Vr component:  
ğ…ğ‚ğŒ°ğŒºğŒ° 	 vraka 	Frage!   persecution  
ğ…ğ‚ğ‰ğŒ·ğƒ 	 vrÅá¸«s 	Frage!	 accusation  

If there truely once was a more complicated reading it is completely (or easily) forgotten because the 'simplified' reading has become 100% our own:  

ğ…ğŒ¹ğŒ³ğŒ¿ğ…ğ‰ 	 Widwe  
ğ…ğ‰ğŒºğ‚ğƒ 	 Wucherei!  

In one example ğ… actually corresponds to modern Y :)  
ğƒğ…ğ‚ğŒ¹ğŒ°!	 Syria
